Package imagingbook.lib.util.progress.ij

Class ProgressBarMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • imagingbook.lib.util.progress.ProgressMonitor
        • imagingbook.lib.util.progress.ij.ProgressBarMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable
    public class ProgressBarMonitor
extends ProgressMonitor
    An instance of this class monitors the progress of another object (task) by querying its status periodically. TODO: Make the associated action more generic (currently progress information is used to update ImageJ's peogress bar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgressBarMonitor

        public ProgressBarMonitor​(ProgressReporter target)

    • Method Detail

      • handleProgress

        public void handleProgress​(double progress,
                           long nanoTime)
        Description copied from class: ProgressMonitor
        Abstract method to be implemented by concrete sub-classes. It is called by the ProgressMonitor thread in regular intervals. Current progress data are passed. It is up to the implementation what action should be performed, e.g., display the current progress graphically (see e.g. ProgressBarMonitor).
        Specified by:
        handleProgress in class ProgressMonitor
        Parameters:
        progress - the current progress value [0,1)
        nanoTime - the time elapsed since the progress monitor was started (in nanoseconds)
